markers stitches/techniques chain- chain single_crochet- single_crochet decrease- single_crochet decrease half_double_crochet- half_double_crochet hdc2tog - half_double_crochet decrease double_crochet- double_crochet fpdc- front post double_crochet bpdc- back post double_crochet whip stitch sewing stitch - or preferred method of joining panels together notes -chain does not count as first stitch -you will need to crochet one back panel two front panels worked in row -sleeves worked in rounds -you can alter your cardigan to any length you can add more/less stripes to panels and sleeves to increase/decrease length -every color stripe is 8 row of half_double_crochet -the starting chain for your back panel decides how wide your cardigan will be grab a measuring tape and measure from the middle of one bicep up across your back and to the middle of the other bicep for more of an oversized fit add more chains -take note of any changes you make along the way for your best fit -the distressed look or rips as they will be referred to in this pa�ern are made by a series of chains the instructions for the rip will be in when referenced in pa�ern follow what s in red to make
